newsitem.title: USA: Employee Solutions named in holder suit.
newsitem.headline: Employee Solutions named in holder suit.

text.p: Lawyers for the purchasers of Employee Solutions Inc common stock during an almost two-year period said a class action complaint has been filed accusing the company of inflating its reported earnings.
The complaint accuses the company of violating federal securities laws by charging and collecting excess federal and state unemployment taxes from customers beyond what they were required to pay.
Then, the complaint alleges, the company illegally included this money in its reported earnings.
The complaint also accuses the company of failing to establish and maintain adequate reserves for potential workers' compensation insurance claims.
The complaint was filed by Pomerantz Haudek Block & Grossman and Dalton Gotto Samson & Kilgard PLC in the United States District Court for the District of Arizona (Phoenix).
The attorneys said the complaint represents purchasers of stock between March 24, 1995 and March 17, 1997.
The complaint was filed against the company, its chief executive and its chief financial officer
The lawyers said they learned of the issue when the company released on March 17 its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 1996.
The plaintiffs seek to recover damages.
Several similar lawsuits have been previously filed against the company, which has said that the complaints have no merit and that it would defend itself vigorously.
